what: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: package create labels, certificates, much ! :) need create attendance participation certificates, accreditation badges, herbarium collection labels, labeleR package need! Keep eye easy tutorial use !

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: install labeleR GitHub, might need install devtools package. , just specify repository install! want clone repository, can find code .
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("EcologyR/labeleR") library(labeleR)

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: first place, must warn renderization documents labeleR depends LaTeX, must installed first place. Don’t worry, easy! don’t tinytex installed, ’s first time use labeleR may take packages correctly installed. Don’t worry, much quicker next time!
code: # install.packages("tinytex") tinytex::install_tinytex()

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: first thing need start using labeleR data frame information included. data frame can imported R environment reading file (e.g. ‘.csv’ file ‘.xlsx’ excel sheet, using read.table( ) alike functions), can also imported Google Sheets function. , just use gsheet’s gsheet2tbl function, specifying Google Sheet URL. fact, don’t need use whole URL, just specific part . instance, URL: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw/edit#gid=0” just need text bold. However, key point bear mind Google Sheet document must grant (least viewer) access anyone link; otherwise R able open . Finally, order labeleR work correctly, imported table converted data frame.
code: library(gsheet)  #URL: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw/edit#gid=0 people_list_long <- gsheet2tbl("1inkk3_oNvvt8ajdK4wOkSgPoUyE8JzENrZgSTFJEFBw") people_list_long <- as.data.frame(people_list_long)

what: 1.3 Some advice for the labeleR functions
title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: using labeleR’s functions, widely used parameters nomenclature must acknowledged. parameters, remain always . first one data, data frame previously loaded . second one path, folder outputted PDFs stored. case specified folder exist, automatically created. case want name output PDF file certain way, must specify using filename argument. Additionally, can store created intermediate files using keep.files = TRUE. Ultimately, labeleR uses templates create documents. However, can downloaded modified specific purposes user. , open new RMarkdown file RStudio, using labeleR template want edit, saving locally, specify directory path template argument. files, pictures (logos signatures) can included. , parameter names lpic (standing left picture, top), rpic (right picture, also top) signature.pic (signature picture) certificates; logo collection label. pictures specified path picture stored. parameters nomenclature, two kinds. “Fixed parameters” remain certificates (e.g. name conference accreditation, name speaker attendance certificate). parameters named using unique word (e.g. event speaker), can filled using free text printed documents. hand, “variable parameters” vary among documents, therefore differ among rows (e.g. attendees names conference, species herbarium labels). specify column data information stored, two-word parameters used (.e. name.column species.column). parameter follow philosophy qr functions allow plot (.e. create_herbarium_label, create_collection_label create_tinylabel). parameter can set column name, result variable parameter, free text (column name), used fixed one.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Now let’s start using labeleR! help see structure templates visual way, display examples inspired Harry Potter universe.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Attendance certificates one least variable certificates; variable parameter name attendees. template allows include signature image, signer go . certificate available english spanish. case pictures look big small, recommend modify size, set given height. structure certificate looks follows.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, create four different certificates four students Hogwarts School, Headmaster certifies attended 200 h Potions class. example, certificate rendered individual PDF document.
code: create_certificate_attendance(   data = attendance.table,   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "attendance_certificates",   language = "English" ,   name.column = "Names",   type = "class",   title = "Potions (year 1992-1993)",   date = "23/06/1993",   hours = "200",   freetext = "taught by Professor S. Snape",   signer = "A.P.W.B. Dumbledore",   signer.role = "School Headmaster",   rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   signature.pic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/dumbledore.png", package = "labeleR") )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Participation certificates similar previous, variable parameters (speaker, title type communication, etc.). well attendance certificate, documents can rendered english spanish.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: , Albus Dumbledore certifies four school teachers participated seminars different titles, different affiliations, dates communication types. example, certificate rendered individual PDF document.
code: create_certificate_participation(   data = participation.table,   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "participation_certificates",   language = "English",   name.column = "Name",   affiliation.column = "House",   comm.type.column = "Comm.type",   title.column = "Title",   date.column = "Date",   type = "online",   event = "seminar",   freetext = "organized by Hogwarts School of Magic and Wizardry",   signer = "A.P.W.B. Dumbledore",   signer.role = "School Headmaster",   rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/MinMagic.png", package = "labeleR"),   signature.pic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/dumbledore.png", package = "labeleR") )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Badges (documents now onwards) rendered single document, eight accreditation cards per DIN-A4 page case. two variable fields (name affiliation), can include two top images, although signed. Accreditation cards include dot line bottom individual hand-edition.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, present accreditation cards might used International Conference Muggleology, changing fields names affiliations attendees.
code: create_badge(   data = badges.table,   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "badges",   event = "INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE OF MUGGLEOLOGY",   name.column = "List",   affiliation.column = "Affiliation",   rpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_logo.png", package = "labeleR"),   lpic=system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/minMagic.png", package = "labeleR") )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Herbarium labels one documents variable parameters, lot information included. , used template believe useful, included three free fields user include information prefer. course, field’s name force user use category (location can set elevation column, top; vice versa), family.column content always capitalized, taxon.column one italics, recommend use stated. said , QR can stand free text (therefore remain identical labels), column name, therefore codes rendered specify individual information row. Including long texts may cause alteration structure labels, recommend concise.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example, show labels students created herbarium assignment Herbology class.
code: create_herbarium_label(   data = herbarium.table,   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "herbarium_labels",   qr="QR_code",   title ="Magical flora of the British Isles" ,   subtitle = "Project: Eliminating plant blindness in Hogwarts students",   family.column = "Family",   taxon.column = "Taxon",   author.column = "Author",   det.column = "det",   date.det.column = "Det_date",   location.column = "Location",   area.description.column = "Area_description",   latitude.column = "Latitude",   longitude.column = "Longitude",   elevation.column = "Elevation",   field1.column = "life_form",   field2.column = "Observations",   field3.column = "Height",   collector.column = "Collector",   collection.column = "Collection_number",   assistants.column = "Assistants",   date.column = "Date" )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: Collection labels one aesthetic labels. five variable parameters (recommended long, explained herbarium labels), along possibility including QR code (fixed variable), logo image. Field 1 capitalized (family.column herbarium label, Field 2 italicized). fields can left blank. novelty, user may manually fix backgroud text colours preference, using HTML colour codes (code HEX, without ‘#’). default, background colours two hues green.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: example can see six labels created school’s displayed collection stuffed animals.
code: create_collection_label(   data = label.table,   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "labels",   qr="QR_code",   field1.column = "field1",   field2.column = "field2",   field3.column = "field3",   field4.column = "field6",   field5.column = "field7",   system.file("rmarkdown/pictures/Hogwarts_BnW.png", package = "labeleR"),   bgcolor = "D0ECC1",  #White is "FFFFFF",   textcolor = "1E3F20" #Black is "000000" )

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: type labels simplified version previous, includes just five variable fields possibility including QR code. recommend previous cases include long texts neither variable parameters QR, can become difficult read. Tinylabels printed arrays 8x2 labels per page. case size big pretended use (can happen small insect collections, example), recommend use “print several pages per sheet” printer’s options.

title: Package to create your own labels, certificates, and much more! :)
text: , tinylabels created typical collections stored boxes, normal collection label big.
code: create_tinylabel(   data = tiny.table,   qr="QR_code",   path = "labeleR_output",   filename = "tinylabels",   field1.column ="field2",   field2.column ="field1",   field3.column ="field3",   field4.column ="field4",   field5.column ="field5"  )

title: Function to create accreditation cards (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_accreditation
text: data data frame including names affiliations (optional affiliation.column NULL) create accreditation cards. path Folder path output printed event Title event name.column Column name data data frame specifies participant's name. affiliation.column Column name data data frame specifies participant's affiliation. lpic PNG object route. File route top-left image. Can blank set NULL. rpic PNG object route. File route top-right image. Can blank set NULL.

title: Function to create accreditation cards (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_accreditation
text: 'output' folder PDF documents inside

title: Function to create accreditation cards (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_accreditation
text: Julia G. de Aledo, Ignacio Ramos-Gutierrez

title: Function to create accreditation cards (8 per DIN-A4 page) — create_accreditation
code: if (FALSE) { data <- read_sheet(url='https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d         /16smXdP-Ehwu1cEmJTbJI1DerIpUrOcD7H5Ni6z9B07M/edit#gid=0') create_accreditation(data=data, path = "LabeleR_output", event="INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE OF MUGGLEOLOGY", name.column = "List", affiliation.column="Affiliation", lpic = NULL, rpic = NULL) }

title: Create badges — create_badge
text: Create badges (8 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Create badges — create_badge
code: create_badge(   data = NULL,   path = NULL,   filename = NULL,   event = NULL,   name.column = NULL,   affiliation.column = NULL,   lpic = NULL,   rpic = NULL,   keep.files = FALSE,   template = NULL )

title: Create badges — create_badge
text: data data frame including names (optionally) affiliations. path Character. Path folder PDF file saved. filename Character. Filename pdf. NULL, default "Badges". event Character. Title event. name.column Character. Name column data storing participants' name. affiliation.column Character (optional). Name column data storing participants' affiliation. lpic Character (optional) Path PNG image located badge top-left. rpic Character (optional) Path PNG image located badge top-right. keep.files Logical. Keep Rmarkdown template associated files output folder? Default FALSE. template Character (optional) Rmarkdown template use. provided, using default template included labeleR.

title: Create badges — create_badge
text: PDF file named "Badges.pdf" saved disk, folder defined path. keep.files = TRUE, Rmarkdown PNG lpic rpic files also appear folder.

title: Create badges — create_badge
text: Ignacio Ramos-Gutiérrez, Julia G. de Aledo, Francisco Rodríguez-Sánchez

title: Create badges — create_badge
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() create_badge( data = badges.table, path = "labeleR_output", filename = NULL, event = "INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE OF MUGGLEOLOGY", name.column = "List", affiliation.column = "Affiliation", lpic = NULL, rpic = NULL) }

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
text: Create certificate attendance (1 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
code: create_certificate_attendance(   data = NULL,   path = NULL,   filename = NULL,   language = c("English", "Spanish"),   name.column = NULL,   type = "",   title = "",   date = "",   hours = "",   freetext = "",   signer = "",   signer.role = "",   signature.pic = NULL,   lpic = NULL,   rpic = NULL,   keep.files = FALSE,   template = NULL )

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
text: data data frame containing attendees' names (name.column) path Character. Path folder PDF certificates saved. filename Character. Filename pdf. NULL, default "Attendance" English, "Asistencia" Spanish". language Character. Select 'English' 'Spanish'. name.column Character. Name column data storing attendees' name. type Character (optional). Type event (conference, workshop, seminar...) title Character. Title event date Date event hours Number hours event lasted freetext Character (optional). Free text insert event title date. Can include LaTeX commands (see examples). signer Character. Person signs certificate signer.role Character. Signer's role position signature.pic Character (optional). Path PNG image appear bottom, signer's name. lpic Character (optional). Path PNG image appear top-left. rpic Character (optional). Path PNG image appear top-right. keep.files Logical. Keep Rmarkdown template associated files output folder? Default FALSE. template Character (optional) Rmarkdown template use. provided, using default template included labeleR.

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
text: PDF certificates saved disk, folder defined path. keep.files = TRUE, Rmarkdown template PNG logo files also appear folder.

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
text: Ignacio Ramos-Gutiérrez, Julia G. de Aledo, Francisco Rodríguez-Sánchez

title: Create certificate of attendance — create_certificate_attendance
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  create_certificate_attendance( data = attendance.table, path = "labeleR_output", language = "English", name.column = "Names", type = "class", title = "Potions Class", date = "01/01/2021", hours = 200, freetext = "organised by {\\bf Hogwarts School year 1992-1993}", signer = "A.P.W.B. Dumbledore", signer.role = "School Headmaster", lpic = NULL, rpic = NULL, signature.pic = NULL, ) }

title: Create certificate of participation — create_certificate_participation
text: Create certificate participation  (1 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Create certificate of participation — create_certificate_participation
code: create_certificate_participation(   data = NULL,   path = NULL,   filename = NULL,   language = c("English", "Spanish"),   name.column = NULL,   affiliation.column = NULL,   comm.type.column = NULL,   title.column = NULL,   date.column = NULL,   type = "",   event = "",   freetext = "",   signer = "",   signer.role = "",   signature.pic = NULL,   lpic = NULL,   rpic = NULL,   keep.files = FALSE,   template = NULL )

title: Create certificate of participation — create_certificate_participation
text: data data frame containing participants' names contributions. path path Character. Path folder PDF certificates saved. filename Character. Filename pdf. NULL, default "Participation" English, "Participacion" Spanish". language Character. Select 'English' 'Spanish'. name.column Character. Name column data storing participants' name. affiliation.column Character (optional). Name column data storing participants' affiliation comm.type.column Character. Name column data reporting participation type (e.g. poster, oral communication, etc) title.column Character. Name column data storing title contribution. date.column Character. Name column data storing dates participation. type Character (optional). Type event (conference, workshop, seminar...) event Character. Title event freetext Character (optional). Free text insert date. Can include LaTeX commands (see examples). signer Character. Person signs certificate signer.role Character. Signer's role position signature.pic Character (optional) Path PNG image appear bottom, signer's name. lpic Character (optional) Path PNG image appear top-left. rpic Character (optional) Path PNG image appear top-right. keep.files Logical. Keep Rmarkdown template associated files output folder? Default FALSE. template Character (optional) Rmarkdown template use. provided, using default template included labeleR.

title: Create certificate of participation — create_certificate_participation
text: PDF certificates saved disk, folder defined path. keep.files = TRUE, Rmarkdown template PNG logo files also appear folder.

text: Ignacio Ramos-Gutiérrez, Julia G. de Aledo, Francisco Rodríguez-Sánchez

Dumbledore", signer.role = "School Headmaster", lpic = NULL, rpic = NULL, signature.pic = NULL ) }

title: Create collection labels — create_collection_label
text: Create collection labels (8 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Create collection labels — create_collection_label
code: create_collection_label(   data = NULL,   path = NULL,   filename = NULL,   qr = NULL,   field1.column = NULL,   field2.column = NULL,   field3.column = NULL,   field4.column = NULL,   field5.column = NULL,   logo = NULL,   bgcolor = "D0ECC1",   textcolor = "1E3F20",   keep.files = FALSE,   template = NULL )

title: Create collection labels — create_collection_label
text: data data frame. row contains information species appear label. path Character. Path folder PDF file saved. filename Character. Filename pdf. NULL, default "Collection_label". qr String. Free text column data specifies link create QR code. specified value column name data, QRs equal, output specified qr. field1.column Character (optional). Name column data storing first free text appear top label. field2.column Character (optional). Name column data storing second free text appear field1. field3.column Character (optional). Name column data storing third free text appear field2. field4.column Character (optional). Name column data storing fourth free text appear field3. field5.column Character (optional). Name column data storing fifth free text appear field4. logo Character (optional) Path PNG image located label bottom. bgcolor HTML color label background. Default D0ECC1 textcolor HTML color label text. Default 1E3F20 #' @return PDF file named "Collection_label.pdf" saved disk, folder defined path. keep.files = TRUE, Rmarkdown PNG logo files also appear folder.

title: Create collection labels — create_collection_label
text: Ignacio Ramos-Gutiérrez, Julia G. de Aledo, Francisco Rodríguez-Sánchez

title: Create collection labels — create_collection_label
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  create_collection_label( data = collection.table, path = "LabeleR_output", qr = "QR_code", field1.column = "field1", field2.column = "field2", field3.column = "field3", field4.column = "field6", field5.column = "field7" ) }

title: Create herbarium labels — create_herbarium_label
text: Create herbarium labels (4 per DIN-A4 page)

title: Create herbarium labels — create_herbarium_label
code: create_herbarium_label(   data = data,   path = NULL,   filename = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   qr = NULL,   family.column = NULL,   taxon.column = NULL,   author.column = NULL,   det.column = NULL,   date.det.column = NULL,   location.column = NULL,   area.description.column = NULL,   latitude.column = NULL,   longitude.column = NULL,   elevation.column = NULL,   field1.column = NULL,   field2.column = NULL,   field3.column = NULL,   collector.column = NULL,   collection.column = NULL,   assistants.column = NULL,   date.column = NULL,   keep.files = FALSE,   template = NULL )

title: Create herbarium labels — create_herbarium_label
text: data data frame. row contains information species appear label. path Character. Path folder PDF file saved. filename Character. Filename pdf. NULL, default "Herbarium". title Main title top labels. Can blank set NULL. subtitle Subtitle bottom labels. Can blank set NULL. qr String. Free text column data specifies text create QR code. specified value column name data, QRs equal, output specified qr. family.column Character (optional). Name column data storing family taxon. taxon.column Character (optional). Name column data storing taxons' name. author.column Character (optional). Name column data storing taxons' author. det.column Character (optional). Name column data storing determiner voucher. date.det.column Character (optional). Name column data storing date voucher determined. location.column Character (optional). Name column data storing voucher collected. area.description.column Character (optional). Name column data storing decription area. latitude.column Character (optional). Name column data storing latitude specimen collected. longitude.column Character (optional). Name column data storing longitude specimen collected. elevation.column Character (optional). Name column data storing elevation specimen collected. field1.column Character (optional). Name column data storing first free text appear top label. field2.column Character (optional). Name column data storing second free text appear field1. field3.column Character (optional). Name column data storing second free text appear field2. collector.column Character (optional). Name column data storing name collector. collection.column Character (optional). Name column data storing voucher's collection number. assistants.column Character (optional). Name column data storing names collector's assistants. date.column Character (optional). Name column data storing date specimen collected.

title: Subtract numeric values — resta
code: resta(2, 3) #> [1] -1 resta(c(2, 2), c(3, 3)) #> [1] -1 -1  if (FALSE) { resta(c(2, 2), c(3, 3), warn.negative = TRUE)  # gives warning }
